alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:11AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Darlington and southwestern Marlboro Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 910 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of North Hartsville, or 9 miles northeast of Hartsville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Darlington, Dovesville, Mechanicsville, Mont Clare, Auburn, Floyd, North Hartsville and Society Hill. This includes Interstate 95 in South Carolina near mile marker 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
